hanzi-su-wiki:
萌

Значения

Распускаться; росток; проявлять признаки, проявляться; давать ростки; симптом; прорастание

Мнемоника

На ярком 明 весеннем солнце даёт ростки трава 艹.

Варианты

萠
purpleculture_pinyin:
méng
to sprout; to bud; to have a strong affection for (slang); adorable (loanword from Japanese 萌 え moe, slang describing affection for a cute character)
прорасти; бутонить; иметь сильную привязанность к (сленгу); очаровательны (заимствованное из японского 萌 え moe, сленг, описывающий привязанность к милому персонажу)
rtega_mnemonic:
萌萌RSbud, sprout, harbour, beginning
  • plants 艹 budding or sprouting in the light 明
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 明 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
萌芽 [ méng yá ]: to sprout (lit. or fig.); to bud; to germinate; germ; seed; bud
萌发 [ méng fā ]: to sprout; to shoot; to bud
萌生 [ méng shēng ]: to burgeon; to produce; to conceive; to be in the initial stage
萌动 [ méng dòng ]: to sprout; (fig.) to emerge
故态复萌 [ gù tài fù méng ]: to revert to old ways

heisig_chinese_memo: You need a lot of bright light for flowers to bud.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: show symptoms of, sprout, bud, malt
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have to put flowers in a bright place if you want them to sprout. If they're left in the shade they'll just rot.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture your flowers sprouting out of the ground in the bright spring sun.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You want to grow these sprouts in your home (ほう), not outside. So you need to find the windows in your house that are the brightest.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Take a walk around your home right now. Can you find the best place to sprout flowers? Remember, it has to be nice and bright! Not dark and damp. Don't put them in your closet.
Ru_Meaning: show symptoms of, sprout, bud, malt

méng: (графема) давать почки, прорастать; начинать(ся)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the bright (明) grass (艹) is germinating
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You need a lot of bright light for flowers to bud.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "艸", " Ming ", the original meaning is plant buds. "Shuowen": "Chasing buds. From the chasing, clear sound." "Book of Rites-Yueling": "(Jichun Zhiyue) angry Fang Sheng, Yang Qi vents, the sentence is completed, the sprout is full." Zheng Xuan Note: "Sentence, the one who bends the life. The mang and straight says Meng."

" Sprout " can mean that plants are sprouting. Han Wangyi's "Nine Thoughts-Injury Time": "The wind is so warm and warm, the grasses are cute and beautiful."

" Moe " is also a metaphor for the development trend, situation, and beginning of things that have just revealed. "Han Feizi-Shuo Lin Shang": "The saint sees the micro to know the cuteness, and sees the end to know the end."

" Moe " also means beginning and generation. "Historical Records-Preface to the Biography of Cool Officials": "In the past, the world's web was very close, but when the treacherous and falsehoods sprout, their extremes are also fleeing from top to bottom, and they are not recovered."

" Moe " also means hoeing. "Zhou Li‧Qiuguan‧Nuishi": "The palm kills the grass, and spring begins to be born and sprouts." Zheng Xuan's note: "Those who are cute, use them to pluck their lives." Kong Yingdashu: "Han times , The hoe of today."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "艸", " Ming ", the original meaning is plant bud.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「明」聲，本義為植物的芽。《說文》：「艸芽也。从艸，明聲。」 《禮記‧月令》：「（季春之月）生氣方盛，陽氣發泄，句者畢出，萌者盡達。」鄭玄注：「句，屈生者。芒而直曰萌。」

　　「萌」可表示草木發芽。漢王逸《九思‧傷時》：「風習習兮龢煖，百草萌兮華榮。」

　　「萌」也比喻事情剛剛顯露的發展趨勢或情況、開端。《韓非子‧說林上》：「聖人見微以知萌，見端以知末。」

　　「萌」還表示開始、產生。《史記‧酷吏列傳序》：「昔天下之網嘗密矣，然奸偽萌起，其極也，上下相遁，至於不振。」

　　「萌」也表示鋤去。《周禮‧秋官‧薙氏》：「掌殺草，春始生而萌之。」鄭玄注：「謂萌之者，以茲其斫其生者。」孔穎達疏：「漢時茲其，即今之鋤也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「明」聲，本義為植物的芽。

Chinese: You need a lot of bright light for flowers to bud.
Meaning: bud
Story: You need a lot of bright light for flowers to bud.
Kind: both

從「 艸 」，「 明 」聲，本義為植物的芽。《說文》：「艸芽也。从艸，明聲。」 《禮記‧月令》：「（季春之月）生氣方盛，陽氣發泄，句者畢出，萌者盡達。」鄭玄注：「句，屈生者。芒而直曰萌。」 「 萌 」可表示草木發芽。漢王逸《九思‧傷時》：「風習習兮龢煖，百草萌兮華榮。」 「 萌 」也比喻事情剛剛顯露的發展趨勢或情況、開端。《韓非子‧說林上》：「聖人見微以知萌，見端以知末。」 「 萌 」還表示開始、產生。《史記‧酷吏列傳序》：「昔天下之網嘗密矣，然奸偽萌起，其極也，上下相遁，至於不振。」 「 萌 」也表示鋤去。《周禮‧秋官‧薙氏》：「掌殺草，春始生而萌之。」鄭玄注：「謂萌之者，以茲其斫其生者。」孔穎達疏：「漢時茲其，即今之鋤也。」
From the sound of " 艸", " Ming", the original meaning is plant buds. "Shuowen": "Chasing buds. From the chasing, clear sound." "Book of Rites-Yueling": "(Jichun Zhiyue) angry Fang Sheng, Yang Qi vents, the sentence is completed, the sprout is full." Zheng Xuan Note: "Sentence, the one who bends the life. The mang and straight says Meng." " Sprout" can mean that plants are sprouting. Han Wangyi's "Nine Thoughts-Injury Time": "The wind is so warm and warm, the grasses are cute and beautiful." " Moe" is also a metaphor for the development trend, situation, and beginning of things that have just revealed. "Han Feizi-Shuo Lin Shang": "The saint sees the micro to know the cuteness, and sees the end to know the end." " Moe" also means beginning and generation. "Historical Records-Preface to the Biography of Cool Officials": "In the past, the world's web was very close, but when the treacherous and falsehoods sprout, their extremes are also fleeing from top to bottom, and they are not recovered." " Moe" also means hoeing. "Zhou Li‧Qiuguan‧Nuishi": "The palm kills the grass, and spring begins to be born and sprouts." Zheng Xuan's note: "Those who are cute, use them to pluck their lives." Kong Yingdashu: "Han times , The hoe of today."

Chinese dictionary definition of words

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Cute
Source glyph
Cute
Name meaning
: Refers to growth, beginning, and rebirth.
méng
I сущ.
1) почка (дерева); росток (бамбука); побег (напр. травы)
萌蘖 почки и свежая поросль
2) зародыш, начало
见微以知萌 смотреть на малое и через него познать зарождение (вещи, явления)
3) люди, народ; простой народ
宾萌 посетители, гости
II гл.
1) давать почки (свежие побеги); прорастать
复萌 ожить вновь, воскреснуть
2) появляться, возникать; начинаться
远见于未萌 видеть далеко вперёд то, что готово возникнуть
萌于四方 появиться повсюду
3) * пахать; перепахивать
春始生而萌之 весной прорастают (эти всходы), но их перепахивают
II прил.
милый, симпатичный (от яп. "моэ")
IV наречие
во множестве, бурно
萌兴 подняться во множестве
IV собств.
Мэн (фамилия)
Radicals: 艹, 明  (flowers, bright)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have to put flowers in a bright place if you want them to sprout. If they're left in the shade they'll just rot.
Picture your flowers sprouting out of the ground in the bright spring sun.
Reading Mnemonic
You want to grow these sprouts in your home (ほう), not outside. So you need to find the windows in your house that are the brightest.
Take a walk around your home right now. Can you find the best place to sprout flowers? Remember, it has to be nice and bright! Not dark and damp. Don't put them in your closet.
